pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:0.4: The sub-chapter on the dark of the night
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:0.5: 16. The training rule on sitting down without asking permission
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā visited families after the meal, and she sat down and lay down on the seats without asking permission of the owners.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.3: Feeling scruples because of Thullanandā, people there neither sat down nor lay down.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.4: They then complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.5: “How could Venerable Thullanandā visit families after the meal, and then sit down and lie down on the seats without asking permission of the owners?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.6: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.7: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.8: “How could Venerable Thullanandā act in this way?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.12: “… How could the nun Thullanandā act in this way?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.13: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.14: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.15.1: ‘If a nun visits families after the meal, and then sits down or lies down on a seat without asking permission of the owners, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.6: when the middle of the day has passed, until sunset.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.8: there are four kinds of family: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.11: Without asking permission of the owners:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.12: not having asked permission of a person in that family who is an owner and who has the authority to give.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.14: a place for sitting cross-legged is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.16: if she sits down on that seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.18: if she lies down on that seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.1: If she has not asked permission, and she does not perceive that she has, and she sits down or lies down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.2: If she has not asked permission, but she is unsure of it, and she sits down or lies down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.3: If she has not asked permission, but she perceives that she has, and she sits down or lies down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.4: If it is not a place for sitting cross-legged, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.5: If she has asked permission, but she does not perceive that she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.6: If she has asked permission, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.7: If she has asked permission, and she perceives that she has, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.3.2: if she sits down or lies down after asking permission;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.3.3: if the seat is permanently put out for her;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.3.7: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.3.8: The sixth training rule is finished.
